title: SS Dundee
text:
SS "Dundee" was a steam passenger and cargo ship of the <a href="British%20Merchant%20Navy">British Merchant Navy</a>. She served during the <a href="First%20World%20War">First World War</a> and was lost in 1917.
Career.
"Dundee" was built by <a href="Henry%20Robb">Caledon shipbuilders</a> at their <a href="Dundee">Dundee</a> yards and was <a href="Ship%20naming%20and%20launching">launched</a> on 24 August 1911. She was completed in November 1911 and entered service with the <a href="Dundee%2C%20Perth%20%26amp%3B%20London%20Shipping%20Company">Dundee, Perth & London Shipping Company</a>. She sailed for them until the outbreak of <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a> in 1914, when she was requisitioned for use as an <a href="armed%20boarding%20steamer">armed boarding steamer</a>; as such, she was not a fully commissioned warship of the <a href="Royal%20Navy">Royal Navy</a> and did not carry the "<a href="Her%20Majesty%27s%20Ship">HMS</a>" prefix. On 16 March 1917 she was working in the <a href="Atlantic%20Ocean">Atlantic Ocean</a> with Royal Navy <a href="armoured%20cruiser">armoured cruiser</a> when they stopped the disguised <a href="Imperial%20German%20Navy">Imperial German Navy</a> <a href="auxiliary%20cruiser">auxiliary cruiser</a> . "Dundee" sent out a boat to inspect "Leopard", upon which "Leopard" opened fire and forced "Dundee" to move away. "Achilles" then <a href="Action%20of%2016%20March%201917">opened fire on "Leopard", sinking her</a>.
On 2 September 1917, the German <a href="submarine">submarine</a> <a href="torpedo">torpedo</a>ed and damaged "Dundee" in the Atlantic Ocean southwest of the <a href="Isles%20of%20Scilly">Isles of Scilly</a> (). "Dundee" lost nine members of her crew and sank the next day.
